item.description:
As Halloween approaches, creatures of the night become active. Join us for an evening walk through the woods to uncover the mystery and magic of the forest at night and learn how animals survive in a nocturnal world.

No flashlights allowed!

After the walk, weâ€™ll gather around a campfire to roast marshmallows.

Meet at Park Headquarters at 194 Cranberry Road in South Carver. Program is free and open to the public. For ages 8 and up. Rain cancels. Reasonable accommodations are available upon request. For more information, call (508) 272-9376.

Park information and directions

Sharl says: This is a wonderful hike, even for adults. DCR Interpreter Amy Wilmot is a wonderful night-hike guide. I went last year and loved it. It feels very "ancient" to emerge from out of the dark forest with a "tribe" and head for a blazing campfire. Who doesn't like roasted marshmallows? You'll love it no matter your age.
item.how_to_find_us: Find Amy's warm-up circle in the lawn behind the Interpretive Center

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Halloween Night Hike led by DCR Interpreter Amy Wilmot
